title: Union Savings & Loans Encourages Savings
text:
10 July 2015 10:17 CET Union Savings & Loans Encourages Savings By Daily Guide 
Amanfu demonstrating how to deposit money into the box. 
Union Savings and Loans Limited, one of the oldest savings and loans companies in Ghana, has launched Omni Savings Bonus, an initiative to encourage regular savings. 
According to the company, the savings campaign is aimed at bringing financial freedom to families and individuals, especially in the era of economic hardship. 
The campaign, which begins from July to September 2015, will see staff of the company distributing 'Omni Savings Boxes to people in their homes and offices across the country. 
Deposits slip forms would be given to recipients of the saving boxes to make an initial deposit of GH¢200. 
After the initial deposit, the saver can deposit any amount daily, weekly or monthly. 
The saver would benefit from growing his initial balance by a minimum of GH¢50 every month and earn up to whopping 20 percent per annum. 
Dominic Donkoh, Head of Business Division, Union Savings and Loans, said consistent long-term savings culture had transformed the lives of individuals and families over the years in different parts of the world. 
'We are providing a lasting solution to the low culture of savings in two ways by providing convenient ways to save through the traditional savings box concept. 
'People will drop their daily change or coins from their expenses into the box and our relationship officers will empty the box deposit in the saver's account anytime he or she wishes. The deposit can be confirmed by text message,' he added.
